DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Central Nervous System Vitreous Humor Positive Finding Assessment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether positive vitreous fluid was used in diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Central Nervous System Vitreous Humor Positive Finding Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a diagnostic procedure (methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability) and a positive finding (an observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease or condition) in an assessment of central nervous system (the part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges) vitreous fluid (the clear colorless transparent jelly that fills the posterior chamber of the eyeball).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredName: Central Nervous System Vitreous Humor Positive Finding Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges. :A clear, avascular, gelatinous body that occupies the posterior chamber of the eye. It is bounded by the retina except anteriorly where it lies adjacent to the lens and iris.:An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
The clear colorless transparent jelly that fills the posterior chamber of the eyeball.
A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
